snippet: A young man from Dara’a, Syria, carries a burden — maybe an honor, too: He knows that he and his friends helped start an uprising.
abstract: Group of teenagers from Dara'a, Syria, carry the burden and honor of having participated in an incident that sparked the country's bloody revolution; members of group were arrested and tortured for graffiti challenging the rule of Pres Bashar al-Assad, setting off demonstrations that later widened into civil war.

byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and HWAIDA SAAD
byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Amman, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut, Lebanon. Ranya Kadri contributed reporting from Amman.

lead_paragraph: A young man from Dara’a, Syria, carries a burden — maybe an honor, too: He knows that he and his friends helped start an uprising.

headline.seo: A Faceless Teenage Refugee Who Helped Ignite Syria’s War
headline.main: A Faceless Teenage Refugee Who Helped Ignite Syria’s War
headline.print_headline: A Faceless Teenage Refugee Who Helped Ignite Syria’s War
